page.title: 19A RECENT DEVELOPMENT
page.content:
Wholly contained within our survey area is the{Halsdon Nature Reserve}. Consisting of 140 acres of woodland and meadow on the east bank of the river{Torridge}and in the parish of {Dolton} was purchased with a grant from the World Wildlife Fund and is administered by the Devon Trust For Nature Conservation.
Within the reserve deciduous woods provide cover for nesting birds, particularly summer visitors such as warblers and Pied Flycatchers.Mammals such as Foxes,Badgers and the rare Otter are also found here.The meadows contain uncommon plants and insects.
Such wild-life reserves are of increasing and vital importance due to the demands made by modern agriculture and by housing and road construction.
